primary_reason: Nitrogen is a diatomic molecule (N2) and does not contain carbon-fluorine bonds, which are characteristic of PFAS.
evidence: Nitrogen (N2) is a well-known diatomic molecule with no PFAS characteristics.
Literature and chemical databases confirm that nitrogen does not contain PFAS.
health_problems: Asphyxia due to displacement of oxygen in confined spaces
recommendation: No further investigation is needed as the analyzed material is not expected to contain PFAS.
